comments.commentBody: The original Caligula became Roman Emperor because he had the support of the Praetorian Guard. This Caligula got elected and the Praetorian Guard, alas, is the Republican Party. Oh, where is Claudius when you need him?
He loves Breitbart.  They are scripture to him. Heck, he appointed Bannon his chief strategic adviser.

A first step would be for Trump to release his tax returns. Then a complete mental evaluation - this is not normal behavior. What the American people are left with is to wonder if he is crazy, or if this just more smoke and mirrors to detract us from the real issues or both.

Enough - and the longer Republicans stand mutely by, the more they own this. And the more he pulls the entire world down with him into whatever crazy rabbit hole he came out of.
Quick, Kellyanne, get up off the couch and grab his phone!

Maybe it's Breitbart, but I have another theory -- he doesn't know that cell phones are "tapped" by folks like the NSA, especially if you're say calling Moscow.  So with more news and "transcripts" coming out, he just assumes it's 1990 technology or the like, perhaps on a rotary phone.  Donald, if you're reading this (well, we wonder if you read), just Google "Patriot Act."  Maybe your colleagues should have earlier....

So there is/was no FISA warrant approved in October 2016 against Trump and/or his campaign?

And news that the original FISA warrant applied for in June 2016 was denied is Fakenews?

http://www.motherjones.com/kevin-drum/2017/01/guardian-fbi-asked-warrant...
No one can sabotage Trump's administration better than Trump himself. He's a one-man wrecking ball.
Yeah. I want in on that. Distractions distractions, thats all this is.
Independent  Investigation NOW!
The wire-tapping claim is an obvious and predictable attempt by Trump to divert attention from his campaign's alleged collaboration with the Russians.  Don't fall for it.

""Ben Rhodes, a former top national security aide to Mr. Obama, said in a Twitter message directed at Mr. Trump on Saturday that “no president can order a wiretap” and added,""
What about an Attorney General or F. B. I. director if a President asked them to?

My thoughts...

I believe that the president is fundamentally, dangerously unstable. I have not sat down with the man and performed a clinical psychiatric evaluation, but I find it impossible not to believe that he is severely ADHD and that he suffers from (at a minimum) narcissistic personality disorder, paranoia, bipolar disorder and bouts of mania. Of course, his "suffering" is our suffering, is the world's suffering.

The laws of the country need to be amended such that in order to serve as POTUS a candidate must pass a basic psychiatric evaluation. There are many disorders that would NOT disqualify a person from being an excellent president, but severe mania, paranoia, and narcissistic personality disorder are not among them.
The Russia heat is getting to be too much....must deflect, create a new smokescreen.
We won't have to look at Trump's hair much longer.  It's only a matter of time before he's going to be wearing a tinfoil hat.
You mean like Obama not being American, for instance?
Wasn't the election "rigged?"
This man doesn't seem to realize that he was actually elected president of the United States. He is only comfortable in the role of victim/vengeance seeker. Seriously, what is wrong with him?

Before Mr Trump's inauguration many people thought that once he became POTUS he would act presidential, that the weight at the office would transform him just as if we were going to an upscale restaurant we would know we can clean up, use the right utensils and watch our language. People were hopeful. They should have been fearful.
For some time now many people, including many journalists, noted that Mr Trump's behavior was abnormal for one seeking the presidency. His name calling and numerous falsehoods had apparently been regarded as great theater but it is theater of the Absurd. As we psychologists know abnormal behavior often becomes even more abnormal under stress.
The presidency must be infinitely more stressful than the campaign. It appears as though the current crisis of the administration's dealings with Russia has reached a crescendo and so it is no surprise and that Mr. Trump is making disturbingly wild accusations against Barack Obama, accusing him of wiretapping Trump Tower. As with all my patients for whom I feel compassion as they struggle with their issues I do feel for Mr. Trump. However for all of us who are affected by his decisions and actions I feel fear.

At some point, I think we would all agree that it is a duty of the office of the President of the United States
to behave both unlike a paranoid delusional and unlike a six year old.
to NOT make public pronouncements based on what you read on the internet.

"...unless the Vice President and a majority of either the principal officers of the executive department or of such other body as Congress may by law provide, transmit within four days to the President pro tempore of the Senate and the Speaker of the House of Representatives their written declaration that the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office. "

The NYC Department of Health has run free STD clinic services including diagnosis, treatment and counseling. Many soldiers from Viet Nam were returning to New York City with STDs. Many had no ready access to doctors. But they were fortunate because there were free clinics available throughout the city and available to all from poor to wealthy. The service included locating contacts so those individuals could treated. None of it was considered charity or a handout. Rather, it was good public health policy and for many, the way compassionate government served its citizens. Same goes for women's health services.

Women's health clinics provide expert services because the see so many with all of the issues women present with.

.
I respectfully dissent.

Deb still has to write 8 blogs a week, solve puzzles live on facebook, cajole celebrities to construct puzzles, code the puzzles for all the different platforms, monitor the Comments for sourpusses, etc.

As long as she still gets the medium-sized bucks, the decision is fine. In all frankness, the readership was advised that this was an experiment; yet I never noticed a spontaneous uprising demanding that the 9 a.m. post become a fixture on the site.

I had the National Park Service photograph the attendance at the pro-LVblog Rally and at the anti-LVblog Rally. Melissa McCarthy has declared that attendance at the anti-blog Rally was far larger than at the other one. It's unclear if the President forced the Service to then destroy the photographic evidence.

The people have spoken! So have Deb's bosses, I presume.

"Let’s be clear: This isn’t about the government paying for abortions. That’s already mostly banned."

True on the surface. However, if the government is funding other services, that allows PP to devote more of their non-governmental funds to the abortions.
That's not really how it works, though.  The government money comes to them in the form of reimbursement for actual procedures, and abortion is not reimbursable.

Yours is a common misconception--that Planned Parenthood funding is fungible, and therefore any government funding allows more money to be used for abortions.

PP funding is not fungible. A strict wall is erected between any kind of expense involving abortion and ordinary healthcare expenses, including facilities costs.
Ditto on the "true on the surface." However it also allows for 100% of the government funds to be spent on other services!

Don't expect those with aborted brains to take a common sense view of women's health. Don't expect real facts and figures to make a difference.
It would confuse the ignorant to know that a pro-choice person is as adamantly pro-life as they are. A concept like that requires critical thinking skills. They live on a flat planet.
There's a sort of joke floating around that if men had babies there'd be an abortion clinic on every corner, especially around Capitol Hill.
According the the late Florynce Kennedy, "If men could get pregnant, abortion would be a sacrament."

A bit of Sorkinian dialogue I've always loved:
Sam: I flat-out guarantee you that if men were biologically responsible for procreation, there'd be paid family leave in every Fortune 500.
Ainsley: Sam, if men were biologically responsible for procreation, they'd fall down and die at the first sonogram.
Funny, except the majority of organized resistance to abortion consists of catholic and evangelical women.

It it is "interesting " that maybe a FISA warrant was processed in October perhaps initiated by the FBI while only a mere, what, 15-20 days later FBI Director Comey issued his "unusual " letter to Congress. Just kinda interesting. As we say in corporate America, different work streams, same company, divergent goals.

The Obama administration needs to be investigated to get to the bottom of these allegations and the ongoing attempts to undermine the President.   Hopefully the Obama administration's emails and phone records have been retained for examination.   I know they have had trouble retaining communications in the past.    I'm calling on Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi to investigate this assault on our President.
So, Trump tweets allegations with no proof and you want an investigation launched?  You'd better hope he doesn't tweet allegations about you next.
